attributes.action: Provide better support, funding and awareness for epilepsy patients and families
attributes.background: This is something close to my heart. We sadly lost hayley aged 20 in 2015 to sudep, sudden death caused by an epileptic seizure. Please sign this petition to help raise awareness and funding for this horrible illness. Im seeing more and more tragic losses due to the illness, young lives being lost.
attributes.additional_details:
Sudep action
Epilepsy Scotland

attributes.action: Keep Bishop Auckland urgent care open
attributes.background: They are proposing that they close the urgent care centre in bishop hospital. It is a vital service which has saved two members of my own family and possibly thousands more.
attributes.additional_details: We need to keep it open for the benefit of the population of bishop and surrounding areas. If it closes then I can imagine that death rate would increase dramatically

attributes.action: I want the government to STOP the privatization of the UK.
attributes.background: As 4 year "custodians" of the UK they have no right to sell what is not theirs to sell, their job is to govern the UK for 4 years, if the governments only solution to fixing the UK is to sell it to the highest bidder, they are not fit for purpose, a window cleaner dosnt sell his ladders!
attributes.additional_details:
Too many conflicts of interest surround MPs and their interest to privatize the NHS, The Royal Mail was sold at less than its worth, almost our entire infrastructure has been sold off like some crack addict looking for their next HIT, the list spanning 40 years is shameful and it must stop and stop NOW, https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_privatizations#United_Kingdom
Please support this petition and fight to hold onto whats left of OUR infrastructure paid for from OUR taxes, Thank you.

attributes.action: Bring licensing back for dogs and cats UK. A cost of Â£1 per year per animal.
attributes.background: Dog licensing was abolished in 1984, in most countries it is mandatory to have a license for an animal you own. It is like registering a car to the legal owner. If an animal was to stray or get run over alongside the new microchipping laws, there would be a greater chance of getting a pet back home.
attributes.additional_details: All registrations would begin on 6th April, and must be renewed by 31 March, every year. Each registered dog or cat must wear a tag specifying the council, registration expiry date, and registration number of the dog, with the colour of the tag changing every year for easy identification .  Fees for working dogs (herding dogs, police dogs, drug dogs, etc.) are generally lower than for pets, and seeing-eye or hearing-ear dogs would be  free or minimal cost to register.

attributes.action: Allow buyer to retain 5% of new build house price until build quality is correct
attributes.background: I am a new home owner. A year after moving in, I am fighting the house builder to complete my home to a satisfactory standard. Many of my neighbours are in a similar position. An incentive must be provided for the house builder to complete the house to the required quality standards.
attributes.additional_details: The house builder currently is paid the full amount of the house on exchange no matter how poor the quality of house delivered. New home buyers need more protection - the 10 year warranty is not sufficient to protect against poor quality. If the home buyer can retain 5% of the purchase price, then if the home builder cannot deliver the home to the required cosmetic and structural quality (which can be independently verified), then the home buyer should be allowed to keep the retained capital.

attributes.action: Debate renationalisation of the UK railways.
attributes.background: According to YouGov Polls, 66% of the UK Electorate now support renationalisation of the UK railways. It is clear that privatisation of the railway system has caused massive operation inefficiencies due to the complexity of the railway network. This was the privatization too far.
attributes.additional_details: https://theconversation.com/how-did-britain-fall-out-of-love-with-privatisation-54094

attributes.action: Make it mandatory for anyone who harms a disabled child to go to jail
attributes.background: My son who has autism was assaulted by a member of staff at his care home, she was charged with child cruelty, but because she became pregnant she avoided jail. i think anyone who hurts a disabled child should be sent to jail. if you agree please sign

attributes.action: make it compulsory for all pet sitters to be licenced for all pet related work
attributes.background: Kennels, Pet stores and Home boarders are required to be licenced by the local council but pet sitters and dog walkers are able to trade without any training, experience or governing body allowing anybody to care for peoples pets. This is not only bad for animal welfare but also bad for the industry

attributes.action: Prevent Highways agency from removing centre white lines from UK roads
attributes.background: The Highways Agency argue that removing the centre white line creates driver uncertainty and a resultant reduction in speed which will reduce Road Traffic Collisions. There is a groundswell of opinion that a lot of drivers use the white line as a measure of safe road positioning.
attributes.additional_details:
Speaking to The Times, AAâs head of road policy, Paul Watters, said: âWithout exaggeration it is true to say that a simple pot of paint can save lives.
âIn particular, highly visible markings at the edge and centre of the road that can be seen on a wet night are enormously cost-effective in saving lives.â

attributes.action: Make childcare funding available quickly and pay directly to childcare providers
attributes.background: The HMRC can take up to 12 weeks and often longer before they approve funding and pay out to the parents If the HMRC could change their regulations and give child minders guarantee than parents could go back to employment easier and childcare providers would be assured of payment for their services.
attributes.additional_details: As child minders we find ourselves often in the situation where parents build up a back log of fees outstanding because the HMRC haven't approved their funding or stopped it. What do you do in such a situation? We have built up relationships with the child and its parent(s) and its not in the best interest of the child to terminate it. We want the HMRC to speed up the process and pay the child care provider directly to give us security for the hard work we do.

attributes.action: Introduce incentives for every building to install Solar panels.
attributes.background: The Government should make a real economic investment for the future of the UK's energy security by giving real economic incentives for every home, business, factory, school in the UK to have Solar panels fitted.
attributes.additional_details:
If every home, business, factory, school had Solar panels.
1) They would generate much of their own electrical needs
2) Excess energy goes into the national grid reducing the need for more power stations
3) Gives the UK the biggest renewable power station
4) Ensures the future energy security of the UK
5) Would greatly cut greenhouse emission
6) Makes the UK a world leader in renewable energy and Green

attributes.action: Stop air strikes in Syria and Iraq.
attributes.background: The UK's involvement in military action endangers the lives of innocent civilians in the Middle East and here in Britain where we lay ourselves open to terrorist action. The millions spent on war could be better used to come to the aid of the desperate refugees displaced by conflict.
attributes.additional_details: So called Islamic State are clearly making life hell for the people in the territories they have occupied but by dropping bombs we are only adding to their misery. We are falling into the narrative that Isis has written for us. How can we possibly condemn terrorism whilst murdering innocent people ourselves? It is nonsensical.

attributes.action: Reopen The Security Industry Authority (SIA) Contact Centre
attributes.background: As of the 6th July, The SIA have closed their contact centre in favour of a online application process. Claiming their new self-service website has been designed to provide an easier, more convenient and efficient service but has not lived up to their high expectations.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.facebook.com/thesiauk/

Multiple issues with new self-service website can be seen in the comments of The SIA Facebook page. One of the biggest complaints being unable to receive a response to any issues or queries.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for disabled toilets to be used as storage
attributes.background:
In the news 18th July 2016 eurostar were using disabled toilets for push bikes , this is not unusual in the few months I've found two pubs I'm my local area using their disabled toilet as storage for high chairs .
Disabled toilets are for easy access  not storage.
attributes.additional_details: Eurostar storing bikes in disabled toilets - http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-36820751

attributes.action: Review the child maintenance calculations, in order to make them fairer.
attributes.background:
The child maintenance calculations are unfair to the paying parent, due to the method of calculation. I am asking the relevant Secretary of State to review these calculations and to make them fairer to both the paying and receiving parents. 

This should also include a cap in maintenance payable.
attributes.additional_details:
The Child Maintenance Service uses the tax data from HMRC in order to calculate gross income. This also includes any taxable benefits that are not received as cash. They also have a 20% tolerance for any changes in income (up or down).

This can mean that a paying parent can be on an income of Â£50,000 a year, with a company car and company fuel, and any other benefits such as private health etc, could be seen to have a gross income of Â£60,000 (even though they pay tax on these benefits). Also, due to the tolerance in place, they will not review income changes (even a reduction in income) if it is less than 20% change.

attributes.action: Prevent the sale of ARM Holdings to Softbank
attributes.background: The government should prevent the sale of ARM, the biggest and most successful British technology company to the Japanese company Softbank.  With designs used in over 90% of devices, the idea that only another company can support its growth is invalid.
attributes.additional_details:
If the government truly believes in businesses that can compete in the world then it must realise it takes decades to develop companies such as ARM and coming under foreign ownership when not needed is only ultimately strategically beneficial for the foreign company and bad for national self-esteem.  

The sale of ARM will represent the end of real British involvement in any significant way in the ever-growing, ever important technology sector.

attributes.action: Ensure UK-EU Brexit deal retains our "passporting" rights in financial services
attributes.background: If we lose passporting rights in financial services due to Brexit it could be very damaging for the UK economy as firms re-locate activities to financial centres in the EU; this key issue has been largely ignored by politicians and this petition gives citizens a voice to help protect our economy

attributes.action: Change the conveyancing process in England to make buying & selling more secure.
attributes.background: I have been working in the property industry since 2000 and now own my own Estate Agency firm. Over the last 16 years I have seen thousands of people who have been messed around by buyers and sellers alike. This has resulted in heartache, stress and the loss of substantial amounts of money.
attributes.additional_details: On average over 30% of sales fall through each year in England, the knock on effect of this can ruin peopleâs lives. Almost every country around the world other than England dictates that both, buyers and sellers have to pay a NON refundable deposit to secure the property. If either party withdraw the deposit is forfeited. In England a buyer or seller can pull out up to the day of exchange. One thoughtless person can ruin peopleâs lives with no consequence. Let's put a stop to it.

attributes.action: Hold a voter registration and information day in all schools for 16 year olds.
attributes.background: We are lucky enough to live in a peaceful, democratic country, where each and every citizen has a say in who runs the country. The importance of taking part in democracy and voting cannot be stressed enough, yet information and education on the importance of voting is minimal.
attributes.additional_details: Too often the 18-24 year old demographic has amongst the lowest turnout in elections and referendums. The importance of voting cannot be overstated, yet there is little information on the process and importance of participating in democracy for young adults. Should 16 year olds be able to register to vote in their final year of secondary education they will have two years to learn about our democracy and consider their views, before being eligible to vote at 18.

attributes.action: Guarantee that EU nationals legally settled here before the Referendum can stay.
attributes.background: We should honour our responsibility to treat fairly our friends and colleagues from other EU countries, who were legally settled in the UK before the June 23rd Referendum.

attributes.action: No sex Education in Primary School
attributes.background: Kids  never forgets these videos they watched from school and they come to INTERNET and watch them again and again
attributes.additional_details: Because it's completely inappropriate to the kids in Primary schools..

attributes.action: Make GCSE politics and law compulsory.
attributes.background: The EU referendum results showed that people are easily manipulated by media and propaganda and should have a good basis understanding of law and politics before they should be able to decide the future of the country.

attributes.action: Secure permanent right to reside in the UK for any NHS employee on 23/06/16.
attributes.background: We the undersigned wish that answering 'yes' to the question "Were you working in the NHS on 23/06/16?" means auto-qualification for any future British status.
attributes.additional_details: We cannot risk losing the important foreign peoples that we as a nation have been fortunate enough to bring to the UK and in particular the NHS. Our health would be worse without them and it is imperative that the UK should recognise their importance to our nation by offering them unlimited free passage in to, from and between our country and others.

attributes.action: Make disabled spaces legally enforceable and a legal requirement.
attributes.background: While there are disabled bays provided at most buildings with parking, there is no legal requirement to provide them. The spaces are often abused; disabled drivers can very often not get parked in a bay with the space they need to get in and out, and which is close to the entrance.
attributes.additional_details:
Request

I would like two things. Firstly, I would like to see it made a legal requirement for buildings with parking spaces to provide disabled slots.

Secondly, I would like to see it made an offence to park in a disabled space without the appropriate authority - e.g. a blue badge for instance.

attributes.action: Both parents should have to sign off on the important decisions in a childs life
attributes.background: 8 and half week ago my sons dad decided he was keeping our son and not bringing him home.  I haven't seen or spoke to our son since. His dad was able to change his school and gp without my permission. I want the law to change so that both parents have to agree to important changes in a child's life
attributes.additional_details: Im having to fight tooth and nail just to speak to my son.  My heart is in pieces and i want to make sure no one else has to go through what im currently experiencing. Schools, doctors, passports etc should all have to require both parents signatures,  not just one parent.

attributes.action: Don't implement GCSE exam 9-1 grades, instead have A*, A, B*, B, C*, C, D, E, F.
attributes.background: The justification for swapping from A*-G to 9-1 can be found on the gov.uk webpage in additional details. After reading it I hope you agree it will just serve to cause massive confusion for employers & students. The system I propose keeps the the new 9 grades but is comparable to existing ones.

https://www.tes.com/news/school-news/breaking-news/teachers-confused-over-new-numerical-gcse-grading-system

attributes.action: Raise the voting age in the UK to 28
attributes.background: Due to the level of immaturity shown by the majority  of young people today, lack of respect and generation culture, i feel that at 18, youth dont have not enough experience  to make  judgements that could possibly lead to a nations future.
attributes.additional_details: Lack of participation in national referendum, as low as 28%, meaning they either lack the fundamental knowledge or they just cant be bothered.

attributes.action: Make its so cars don't have to have their number plates on the front.
attributes.background: I don't see it fair that motorbikes are aloud to ride around the uk streets with just a back number plate and no front one, so I think that cars should only have to have a back number plate aswell.

attributes.action: Can you please just raise the speed limit to 80 as 70 is ancient.
attributes.background: I want this petition to go forward as I can not see the point of a 70mph speed limit when on the motorway it feels dangerous as cars fly past well over that and I do not want to break the law to maintain a safe flow of traffic .there is no money for better policing and you cannot fine everybody
attributes.additional_details: Other countries as Czech Republic Romania and Germany all have higher speed limits and this would lower intimidating driving

attributes.action: The UK should join EFTA and should stay out of the EEA and Schengen.
attributes.background: So we can maintain free trade with European countries whilst maintaining our borders outside of the EU

attributes.action: Call a legally binding Euro referendum, 16+ voting age, 2-week campaign.
attributes.background: The non-binding referendum on UK membership of the EU resulted in a majority for 'Leave'. The consequences are becoming apparent. Since the UK has not yet triggered Clause 50, we should re-run the referendum with slightly changed rules, so that voters can decide based on the evidence at hand.
attributes.additional_details: Both sides' campaigns were unsatisfactory in providing objective information about the consequences of deciding to stay or leave. While voters accept exaggeration and distortion of facts during election campaigns, the consequences are generally short-term and reversible due to the 5-year terms of governments. For the EU referendum, however, the consequences are permanent and irreversible. A number of key 'pledges' have already been disowned by Leave campaigners, and some real-life consequences of Brexit have already become apparent. UK voters should take this information into account, and decide what they want.

attributes.action: Referendum on full access to EU single market before invoking Article 50.
attributes.background: Whilst respecting the EU Referendum result the Leave Campaign failed to definitively address with the electorate the issue of access to the single market. This petition seeks to ensure that full access is negotiated before Article 50 is invoked. If this cannot be achieved a referendum must be held.

attributes.action: Call a referendum on the UK joining the European Free Trade Association (EFTA)
attributes.background: EFTA is a free trade area and currently includes Iceland, Liechtenstein, Norway, and Switzerland. It operates in parallel with the EU, and all its member states participate in the EU's single market. Norway rejected membership of the EU in national referendums in 1973 and 1995, but stayed in EFTA.

attributes.action: Lower the Voting Age to 15 so 15-17 year olds can vote.
attributes.background: I think that people aged 15 and above should have the right to vote in future Referendums and Prime Minister Elections. Young adults are taught in Schools about Politics and the Government so they will have a clear understanding of why and what they are voting for.

attributes.action: Hold a new EU referendum if there is a major shift in public opinion.
attributes.background: The consequences of leave have, until now, been pure speculation.  They are now facts and becoming clear: a fall in the pound, threatened major job losses, the break up of the UK.  Had these consequences been clear before the vote, the public may have voted differently and should confirm the vote.

attributes.action: Set up an inquiry into the impact of press reporting on the Brexit vote
attributes.background: A referendum such as on Brexit relies on informed decision making by the public. It is understandable that each side will represent their position in the best light possible. But we need to understand if any persons manipulated public opinion through press reporting beyond the legally acceptable.
attributes.additional_details: Just like the Chilcot inquiry into the Iraq war and the potential manipulation of public opinion through the media, we need a similar inquiry about whether any actors had vested interest in a Brexit and if so, whether they did take any steps to manipulate public opinion in an unacceptable, illegal manner by impacting press reporting on Brexit.

attributes.action: Implement a 2nd EU Referendum allowing 14-17 year olds to vote
attributes.background: We the undersigned call upon the HM Government to debate and implement a second referendum allowing 14-17 year olds to vote as the results effect everyone not only voters aged 18 and over.

attributes.action: Demand a re-evaluation of the Barnett Formula in the wake of leaving the EU
attributes.background: Due to gross inequality in the funding of the home nations by Westminister thus far, extra help from the EU pot has been essential in order to help some regions of the UK to thrive. Now that we've voted to leave, the Barnett Formula must be re-evaluated and modified to meet the needs of the people.
attributes.additional_details: Devolution: What's the Barnett formula? - http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-29477233

attributes.action: Improve refugee policies! Create Syrian refugee policies similar to Germany's!
attributes.background: Five years a war has been raging in Syria! Thousands of innocents are being killed! Millions more are pouring out of Syria, desperate to get to Europe. Instead of doing our utmost to help them we have barred them from our doors! The amount of refugees we've admitted would fit on a train!
attributes.additional_details: Under great pressure the government decided to allow UNNACOMPANIED CHILDREN to enter the country. Apparently nobody likes looking at pictures of 2yr olds and knowing we've sentenced them to death! But it's not just toddlers who can die crossing the Channel. The sight of emaciated 30yr olds huddling on the ground, trying to keep warm should hurt too! Where is your compassion Brits? Where is your pity?

attributes.action: Petition for London and the South East to breakaway from the UK
attributes.background: After the Brexit vote, London clearly has a different stance on the future to the rest of the country. London also has a vastly different economy to the rest of the country so breaking away makes sesne
attributes.additional_details:
Regional Brexit vote split

http://www.bloomberg.com/graphics/2016-brexit-referendum/

attributes.action: Adjust the status of UK residents on Tier2 ICT visa or cancel it from visa types
attributes.background: The Tier2 ICT visa is a new modern slavery, this visa status takes away all your privileges as a human. You pay equal tax as a UK resident yet because people knows that you can't stay for longer than 5 years there are many things you cant do, in my case: adopt, get a mortgage, change jobs and more
attributes.additional_details: UK government have changed the laws so that everyone who's living in UK for more than 183 days becomes a resident and pay tax, however, people in Tier2 ICT visa status do not get any benefits to the contrary, if they can't find a job outside UK within 5 years they end up paying an equal tax to a resident, stuck in a job they don't want to do (many employers abuse there ICT people because they know they own them), no bank will give you a mortgage because they can't trust what will happen to you in 5 years.

attributes.action: Government fund Boot Camps for teenagers instead of children's homes and units
attributes.background: More and more children and teenagers become worse off after being referred to care homes and units. The reason being is that they end up establishing new relationships with others who have considerably worse issues. The result of this can have a severe negative impact rather than help the situation.
attributes.additional_details: We want to prevent children and teenagers from enduring this type of situation. They also regularly go missing from homes resulting in more police resources. Police have confirmed that missing children is a regularity which is often a waste of police time. If we were to introduce teenage bootcamps it would prevent a lot of future crime and saving expenses on services such as police, social work, alcohol addiction, drug rehabilitation, psychologists, prison sentences, teenage pregnancies and more

attributes.action: Call for a vote of no confidence in PM Cameron post EU referendum.
attributes.background: In the event of a leave majority in the forth coming EU referendum we the people request that all Members of Parliament be made directly aware by the House of Commons Speaker to the announcement of our desire for a vote of no confidence in Prime Minister David Cameron.

attributes.action: Boycott the 2018 World Cup in Russia
attributes.background:
After the violence and racism by Russian supporters in the Euro 2016 football tournament in France. 
I would like the Government Ministers to boycott anything to do with the 2018 World Cup in Russia.
attributes.additional_details: If our government can do this. It will show they are looking out for the safety of the British Citizens which would be at risk if they were to fly out there. And with Government support, the British people, FA, World Cup sponsors and other qualifying countries may consider boycotting the tournament as well. Our Gouvernment needs to show it will not support at tournament that was won on bribes and cannot promise the safety of the British public.

attributes.action: Make vaccine inserts mandatory to receive before being given any vaccination.
attributes.background: This isn't about being pro or anti vaccinations. This is about knowledge and being able to make an informed choice in whichever choice you choose.
attributes.additional_details: By reading the vaccine insert it will help educate the person on the possible adverse reactions, it will help parents notice vaccine damage a lot earlier if it arises, you will be able to read the study details and see all ingredients in the vaccination before deciding to go ahead with them.

attributes.action: The government to put political pressure on the US to impose gun restrictions.
attributes.background: It is embarrassing for our nation to be in a close relationship with a country that refuses to put the safety of its citizens first. Today yet another mass shooting has taken place and over 50 members of the LGBT community have died. We can not support any government that allows this to happen.

attributes.action: Public Inquiry and full disclosure of corrupt covert operations
attributes.background:
Request for:
- Public Inquiry
- Full disclosure of official files 
of crimes by State of Human Rights violations against innocent individuals and / or their families subjected to misuse of covert operations and secrets act (including removal of exclusion notices to the innocent person's file).
attributes.additional_details: A person or family to be placed under covert operations must be a threat to national security by government, law enforcement, secret and security organisation, such as espionage, serious crimes and terrorism.  An innocent person exercising their legal rights in any context that is to democratic laws / policy is not a threat to State. Neither should be subjected to misuse of covert operations and their Human Rights violated.  All records collated constitute criminal evidence by such contravention.

attributes.action: Make cycling on a footway an arrestable offence and raise the fine to Â£1,000.
attributes.background: It is a criminal offence in England and Wales to cycle on footways such as pavements, walkways and foot bridges. The current penalty for this is a measly Â£50 fine despite the danger to pedestrians.  Cycling on footways should be arrestable, the fine increased to Â£1,000 and cycles seized until paid.
attributes.additional_details:
With the popularity of cycling in the UK on the up, the numbers of people regularly committing offences such as cycling on the pavement is also increasing. Research has shown that cyclists now represent almost as much danger to pedestrians as motorists do, that the injuries inflicted can be as damaging and nearly 100 people in the UK are killed by cyclists each year.

Making this offence arrestable and increasing the fine will act as a better deterrent and improve pedestrian safety.

attributes.action: Stop testing children in Year 1 on 'alien' words (words that have been made up)!
attributes.background: In Year 1 children take a phonics check.  It is a test made up of real and 'made up' words.  The child is tested to make sure their phonics knowledge is at the expected level.  They should only be tested on real words that are in the dictionary.
attributes.additional_details: It seems so silly to test children who can read fluently on words they will never come across again as they are no where to be found within the English dictionary.  Words such as 'quather' or 'jove'.  The English language is not a phonetically correct language.  We have 26 letters and 44 sounds (43 in some areas because of dialect differences).  Rules for some words are not the same for other words for example, come and home.  The 'o' sound in both words are very different.

attributes.action: Close all remaining 'City' zoo's.
attributes.background: After the events this bank holiday weekend, we feel enough is enough. No longer shall we pay to see animals held in closed captivity. City zoo's across the country should be closed. With such great places as West Midlands safari etc there is no need for city zoo's, anymore.
